body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Starting cygdb on OSX by default just crashes because gdb currently crashes when the `file` command is issued
```
$ cygdb .
gdb command file: Activating virtualenv: ~/debugenv/venv; path_to_activate_this_py: ~/debugenv/venv/bin/activate_this.py
Install pygments for colorized source code.
../../gdb/thread.c:95: internal-error: struct thread_info *inferior_thread(): Assertion `current_thread_ != nullptr' failed.
A problem internal to GDB has been detected,
$
```

See https://www.cygwin.com/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26912 for some details.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
The problem can actually be avoided by skipping the `file` command and passing the path to the interpreter on the command line
```
$ cygdb . -- --args python -c "print('hello')"
gdb command file: Activating virtualenv: /Users/amol/wrk/ursa/debugenv/venv; path_to_activate_this_py: /Users/amol/wrk/ursa/debugenv/venv/bin/activate_this.py
Install pygments for colorized source code.
(gdb) cy run
hello
[Inferior 1 (process 9022) exited normally]
(gdb)
```
This requires by they way to disable the `file` command issued by `Cygdb.py`Â (I just commented `f.write("file %s\n" % interpreter)`). A possible work around might to allow users to explicitly bypass the `file` command using a `--no-interpreter` option to `cygdb`, which still does `cy import` the debugging information but leaves to the user the responsibility to set which target interpreter should be debugged.
title: [ENH] CyGDB can't start on OSX due to setup of interpreter, make interpreter setup optional
